name: Freshwater West
description: Pembrokeshire's most powerful beach. Featured in Harry Potter. Picks up more swell than anywhere in Wales. Strong currents - not for beginners. Spectacular when big.

name: Whitesands Bay
description: Pembrokeshire's most popular surf beach. Consistent waves, RNLI lifeguards, surf school. Near St Davids so gets busy. Beautiful setting.

name: Newgale
description: 2-mile beach with reliable surf. Less powerful than Freshwater West but more accessible. Storm pebble bank at top of beach.

name: Manorbier
description: Beautiful bay beneath castle. Reef at south end gives better shape. Works on south swells when west coast is flat. Uncrowded gem.

name: Broad Haven South
access_notes: Walk from Bosherston car park 15 mins
description: Stunning National Trust beach. Walk in keeps crowds away. Sheltered so works when exposed beaches are maxed out. Lily ponds nearby.

name: Broad Haven (North)
description: Large sandy beach popular with families and beginners. Can get hollow at high tide. Good facilities right on the beachfront.

name: West Angle Bay
description: Sheltered cove that works when the main beaches are blown out. Needs a big swell to wrap in. User friendly but can get rocky at low tide.

name: Marloes Sands
description: Stunning remote beach with scattered rocks. Picks up good swell but requires a walk. Often uncrowded and wild.

name: Abereiddy
description: Slate beach famous for the Blue Lagoon. West facing beach that can hold a decent wave. Watch out for rocks.

name: Tenby South Beach
description: Huge expanse of sand. Generally flat but fires on huge winter swells when west coast is unsurfable. Sheltered from SW winds.
